* Data\-Driven Decisions and Impactful Reporting: Own the data and analytics management and reporting process across all social platforms, leveraging insights to inform strategic decision\-making, identify optimization opportunities, and drive continuous improvement through testing and learning.
* Organic \& Paid Synergy: Partner with go\-to\-market and media teams to develop cohesive organic and paid media strategies across all digital platforms
* Cross\-Functional Collaboration: Partner effectively with Brand, Go\-to\-Market, Product, and Creative teams to develop and test innovative platform features and products aligned with the global strategy.
* Team leadership: Develop and scale your team of community managers, social media experts, platform specialists and copywriters supporting them in their career development. As a key leader on the Integrated Marketing team, contribute to the overall development of Integrated Marketing strategies and capabilities across 2K and Core.


**What Will Make You A Great Fit**
* Integrated Marketing Expertise: An in\-depth understanding of community management, social media platforms (established and emerging), proven audience sentiment and growth tactics, and a track record of creative and relatable storytelling through content. You can identify and capitalize on new global brand opportunities across social, community and influencers.
* Creator \& Influencer Acumen: Experience working closely with influencers, either directly or in partnership with central teams, to identify key talent and develop impactful activation strategies throughout the game lifecycle.
* Analytical Prowess: A strong ability to establish KPIs and analyze data, measuring performance against KPIs, and translating insights into actionable recommendations for ongoing and future channel or general campaign optimization.
* Exceptional Communication Skills: The ability to effectively influence and collaborate within a matrix organization, across departments, and with international teams.
* Proven People Leadership: Experience providing strong direction and leadership to diverse teams, fostering trust and credibility with direct reports and cross\-functional stakeholders.
* Video Game Savvy: Extensive knowledge of video games culture, particularly core games and the audiences that engage with them.


 As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to ensuring that qualified individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform their essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us if you need reasonable accommodation.
   

  

***Please note that 2K Games and its studios never uses instant messaging apps or personal email accounts to contact prospective employees or conduct interviews and when emailing, only use 2K.com accounts.***
 The pay range for this position in California at the start of employment is expected to be between $209,500 and $310,060 per Year. However, base pay offered is based on market location, and may vary further depending on individualized factors for job candidates, such as job\-related knowledge, skills, experience, and other objective business considerations. Subject to those same considerations, the total compensation package for this position may also include other elements, including a bonus and/or equity awards and eligibility to participate in our 401(K) plan and Employee Stock Purchase Program. Regular, full\-time employees are also eligible for a range of benefits at the Company, including: medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance coverage; 14 paid holidays per calendar year; paid vacation time per calendar year (ranging from 15 to 25 days) or eligibility to participate in the Company’s discretionary time off program; up to 10 paid sick days per calendar year; paid parental and compassionate leave; wellbeing programs for mental health and other wellness support; family planning support through Maven; commuter benefits; and reimbursements for fitness\-related expenses.

title: VP FP&A (Modernization & Decision Support)
description:
**Vice President Enterprise Financial Planning \& Analysis** 




  





 Our client hiring a
 **VP of FP\&A to report directly to the CFO.** 
 This is a high\-exposure role with regular interaction with the CEO and Board, shaping how the business plans, forecasts, and tells its performance story.
 



  





 \*\*This search is being led in close partnership with the CFO. Initial conversations are confidential and handled directly through the search lead to ensure context, discretion, and alignment before formal introduction.\*\*
 



  





 Player\-coach role built for a strong
 **FP\&A leader** 



* 20\+ years of deep experience in planning, forecasting, and enterprise decision support
* Proven track record of
 **building or rebuilding FP\&A** 
 in complex manufacturing environments
* **Not** 
 a role for a pure accounting leader with limited FP\&A exposure
* Designed for someone who thrives in
 **high\-expectation, transformation\-driven leadership team**
* Not a steady\-state or oversight\-only role



  





**What You’ll Do** 




 • Own enterprise FP\&A end\-to\-end: forecasting, budgeting, long\-range planning, and scenario modeling
 



 • Partner deeply with operations, sales, and supply chain—comfortable working in the weeds when needed
 



 • Translate complex financial and operational data into clear, credible narratives for the CEO and Board
 



 • Build, rebuild, and modernize FP\&A models, processes, and governance
 



 • Be a Player Coach \- develop a lean FP\&A team
 



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




 • 20\+ years of progressive FP\&A experience, ideally within manufacturing or multi\-site operations
 



 • Demonstrated experience building or rebuilding FP\&A—not inheriting a mature function
 



 • Deep understanding of manufacturing economics and operational drivers
 



 • Strong executive presence with the ability to influence at the C\-suite and Board level
 



 • Hands\-on FP\&A operator with sound judgment on when to dive in vs. delegate
 



  





**Why This Role** 




 • Direct access to the CFO, CEO, and Board
 



 • High visibility and real ownership—your work will shape decisions
 



 • Transformation environment with room to build, automate, and elevate FP\&A
 



  





 Comp:
 



 $220\-230k 30% Bonus / 30% Equity with a strong bonus payout history

title: VP, Worldwide Channel
description:
**Who is Sonar?**
 Sonar helps prevent code quality and code security issues from reaching production, amplifies developers' productivity in concert with AI assistants, and improves the developer experience with streamlined workflows. Sonar analyzes all code, regardless of who writes it — your internal team, genAI, or third parties — resulting in more secure, reliable, and maintainable applications. Rooted in the open source community, Sonar’s solutions support over 30 programming languages, frameworks, and infrastructure technologies. Today, Sonar is used by \+7M developers and 400K organizations worldwide, including the DoD, Microsoft, NASA, MasterCard, Siemens, and T\-Mobile.
   

  

 We believe in developing great products that are supported by great internal teams and a strong culture. We are highly
 **committed** 
 to and
 **obsessed** 
 with the company, users, each other, and our open source community. We have high standards and hold each other accountable for acting with positivity, dedication, thoughtfulness, empathy, and passion daily.
   

  

 We are
 **deliberate** 
 with our decisions with high clarity of intention. At the same time, we feel extreme urgency and move forward quickly.
   

  

 And lastly, we are highly
 **effective** 
 and operationally
 **efficient** 
 . We operate collectively as One Team to accomplish our goals.
   

  

 At Sonar, CODE is more than just an acronym – it's a mindset that defines daily operations.
   

  

**Why You Should Apply:** 
 At Sonar, we’re a group of brilliant, motivated, and driven professionals working hard to help supercharge developers to build better, faster. Sonar helps to continuously improve code quality and code security while reducing developer toil. This means that developers can focus on doing more of what they love and less of what they don’t. Our solutions don’t just solve symptoms of problems – we help fix issues at the source – for all code, whether it's developer\-written, AI\-generated, or from third parties.
   

  

 We have a dynamic culture with employees worldwide and hub offices in the USA, Switzerland, the UK, Singapore, and Germany. Team members should be able to come to work every day, work on a product they are proud of, love what they do, and feel energized by their peers. With our roots deep in the open source community, we’re all about the mission: supercharge developers to build better, faster.
   

  

**The Role**
 Sonar is seeking a highly experienced, results\-oriented, and visionary
 **VP, Worldwide Channels** 
 to lead and expand our global partner ecosystem. Reporting directly to the Chief Revenue Officer (CRO), this critical leadership role is responsible for
 **transforming, defining, executing, and scaling** 
 Sonar’s channel strategy across all worldwide markets to drive net new customer acquisition and significant revenue growth. The VP will work closely with Regional Sales Leadership, Product teams, and other key stakeholders to optimize partner performance and achieve aggressive sales targets.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
**Strategic Leadership \& Revenue Growth**
* Define and Execute Strategy: Develop and implement Sonar's next\-generation Worldwide channel strategy that aligns with overall business objectives and market vision by partnering closely with sales and business unit leaders.
* Drive Revenue: Collaborate with regional leaders and sales teams to influence strategy, drive scalable growth, and deliver quarterly and annual sales targets. Set and achieve aggressive revenue targets by developing new strategic partnerships while scaling existing channel opportunities with key partners.
* Operational Excellence: Drive operational efficiency by overseeing deal registration processes, sales forecasting, and comprehensive channel program management.


**Partner Ecosystem Management**
* Ecosystem Management: Significantly grow revenue through our robust global ecosystem of partners, including resellers, Managed Service Providers (MSPs), Service Providers, and Distributors.
* Relationship Cultivation: Cultivate and deepen relationships with existing top\-tier, strategic partners, serving as a senior point of contact and an executive sponsor to build loyalty and expand market reach.
* Cross\-Functional Collaboration: Work cross\-functionally with internal stakeholders (Sales, Marketing, Product, Customer Success) and external partners and customers to gain support for transformational program initiatives and develop solutions that improve selling opportunities.


**Team Leadership \& Performance**
* Team Leadership: Build, lead, mentor, and scale a high\-performing channel sales team focused on achieving regional and global objectives.
* Performance Metrics: Develop, create, and track Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to monitor team and partner performance, ensuring alignment with revenue and market share goals. Use data\-driven insights to guide decision\-making and improve sales outcomes.
* Culture: Foster a culture of excellence, collaboration, continuous improvement, and high\-impact, ensuring the team is hitting all metrics and quotas.


**Market Presence**
* Market Intelligence: Stay informed of industry trends and competitor activities to adjust strategies, leveraging market intelligence to seize growth opportunities.
* Thought Leadership: Represent Sonar as a thought leader at industry events, conferences, and with key partner executives.


**What You'll Bring (Qualifications And Skills)**
**Core Skills Required:**
* 10\+ years of progressive sales leadership experience in the technology industry, with a minimum of 5\-7 years in channel management or a related senior\-level role in an enterprise B2B software company.
* Proven track record of success in defining and scaling a Worldwide Channels program, with a well\-known personal brand in the channel partner community.
* Strong experience in developing channel sales strategies that have referenceable impact on growth, Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR), and revenue.
* A hands\-on approach to enabling partners and working deals.
* Deep knowledge of sales methodologies (value selling and MEDDPICC) and a history of transforming channel sales organizations into successful selling organizations that are disciplined and structured around selling processes.
* Strong expertise in KPI development and using performance metrics to guide strategic and operational decisions.


**Other Qualifications:**
* Proven experience leading and scaling channel organizations in a complex, fast\-paced environment.
* Strong understanding of sales operations, including forecasting, pipeline management, and incentive structures.
* Exceptional communication, negotiation, and presentation skills, with the ability to influence and build relationships at all levels, from channel partners to C\-suite executives.
* Bachelor’s degree required.


**Other Requirements:**
* Travel required: Yes, 33\-50%
* Desired Location: SF or ATX


**Why You Will Love It Here:**
* Our culture and mission set us apart. We have a dynamic work culture that values respect and kindness and embraces the right to fail (and get right back up again!).
* Great people make a great company. We value people skills as much as technical skills and strive to keep things friendly while still being passionate leaders in our domains.
* We have a flexible work policy that includes 3 days in\-office and 2 days work\-from\-home each week for those located near our office locations; some locations such as Dubai, India, Japan and Australia operate fully remotely.
* We have a growth mindset. We love learning and believe continuous education is critical to our success. In an ever\-changing industry, new skills are necessary, and we're happy to help our team acquire them.
* As the leader in our field, our products and services are as strong as our internal team members.
* We embrace transparency with regular meetings, cascading messages and updates on the growth and success of our organization.


**Benefits**
* Flexible comprehensive employee benefit package.
* We encourage usage of our robust time\-off allocations. You will receive 23 days of PTO per calendar year (on a pro\-rated basis depending on your employment start date), with additional time provided for sickness, life events and holidays.
* We offer an exciting 401(k) plan that has a 4% match, fully vested on day one of participation.
* Generous discretionary Company Growth Bonus, paid annually.
* Fully paid parking in the heart of downtown Austin, Texas.
* Global workforce with employees in 20\+ countries representing 35\+ unique nationalities.
* We have an annual kick\-off somewhere in the world where we meet to build relationships and goals for the company.
* Monthly catered events, and team events


**We Value Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:**
 At Sonar, we believe that our diversity is our strength. We are a global company that values and respects different backgrounds, perspectives, and cultures.
   

  

 We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment where everyone feels valued and empowered to contribute their best. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and welcome all qualified applicants, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.
   

  

**All** 
**offers of employment at Sonar are contingent upon the precise results of a comprehensive background check and reference verification conducted before the start** 
**date.**
**We** 
**do not currently support visa candidates in the US. Applications that are submitted through agencies or third party recruiters will not be considered.**
 We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

title: Senior Director of Community and Digital Content Strategy, Core Games
description:
**Who We Are**
 2K is headquartered in Novato, California and is a wholly owned label of Take\-Two Interactive Software, Inc. (NASDAQ: TTWO). Founded in 2005, 2K Games is a global video game company, publishing titles developed by some of the most influential game development studios in the world. Our studios responsible for developing 2K’s portfolio of world\-class games across multiple platforms, include Visual Concepts, Firaxis, Hangar 13, CatDaddy, Cloud Chamber, 31st Union, HB Studios, and 2K SportsLab. Our portfolio of titles is expanding due to our global strategic plan, building and acquiring exciting studios whose content continues to inspire all of us! 2K publishes titles in today’s most popular gaming genres, including sports, shooters, action, role\-playing, strategy, casual, and family entertainment.
   

  

 Our team of engineers, marketers, artists, writers, data scientists, producers, thinkers and doers, are the professional publishing stewards of 2K’s portfolio currently includes several AAA, sports and entertainment brands, including global powerhouse NBA®️ 2K, renowned BioShock®️, Borderlands®️, Mafia, Sid Meier’s Civilization®️ and XCOM®️ brands; popular WWE®️ 2K and WWE®️ SuperCard franchises, TopSpin 2K25, as well as the critically and commercially acclaimed PGA TOUR®️ 2K.
   

  

 At 2K, we pride ourselves on creating an inclusive work environment, which means encouraging our teams to Come as You Are and do your best work! We encourage ALL applicants to explore our global positions, even if they don’t meet every requirement for the role. If you're interested in the job and think you have what it takes to work at 2K, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

**What We Need**
 Reporting to the VP, Integrated Marketing, your mission will be to define and lead an always\-on community management and digital content strategy that strengthens player engagement, advocacy, and loyalty across all Core titles. You will oversee the development of cohesive content ecosystems and community programs that support our brands year\-round—beyond launch campaigns—building enduring relationships with players and creators worldwide. The role will be based out of our Novato, CA or Culver City, CA offices, with occasional travel to our partners and global offices to foster close collaboration with local teams.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
***Build Vibrant Fandoms and Enduring Player Relationships***
* Lead The Content Strategy, Community, and Social Teams: Lead and develop cohesive content strategies, which includes guiding the digital content, social, community, and creator marketing leads, working as one holistic team within Integrated Marketing and in partnership with the Brand leadership of our four Franchise Groups.
* Represent the Voice of the Player: Foster deep relationships between our players and our franchises, increasing understanding of player needs across the business unit to influence current and future product and marketing roadmaps. Develop and implement platform\-specific global social, community, and creator strategies to increase our presence across social channels, increase cultural relevance for our franchises, and promote positive sentiment and growth for our player communities.
* Player\-First Approach: Partner closely with Player Insights and Data Analytics to map platform strategies to specific audience segments, ensuring content resonates and drives engagement. Develop and implement platform\-specific global social media strategies that elevate our brands and foster a thriving community.
* Growth \& Engagement Focus: Define clear growth and engagement goals for each platform, meticulously tracking progress throughout campaigns as well as for evergreen community health. Proactively identify emerging trends and platforms to keep our titles at the forefront of digital engagement.
* Platform Mastery: Lead our presence across key social platforms including Steam, Instagram, Facebook, X (formerly Twitter), TikTok, LinkedIn, Twitch, Discord, Reddit, and YouTube.
* Content Innovation: Establish, manage and optimize the global content development calendar, prioritizing the creation of platform\-exclusive content across various formats to achieve business objectives and ROI. Educate the broader organization on the value and commercial application of social marketing within the overall marketing funnel.
* Data\-Driven Decisions and Impactful Reporting: Own the data and analytics management and reporting process across all social platforms, leveraging insights to inform strategic decision\-making, identify optimization opportunities, and drive continuous improvement through testing and learning.
* Organic \& Paid Synergy: Partner with go\-to\-market and media teams to develop cohesive organic and paid media strategies across all digital platforms
* Cross\-Functional Collaboration: Partner effectively with Brand, Go\-to\-Market, Product, and Creative teams to develop and test innovative platform features and products aligned with the global strategy.
* Team leadership: Develop and scale your team of community managers, social media experts, platform specialists and copywriters supporting them in their career development. As a key leader on the Integrated Marketing team, contribute to the overall development of Integrated Marketing strategies and capabilities across 2K and Core.


**What Will Make You A Great Fit**
* Integrated Marketing Expertise: An in\-depth understanding of community management, social media platforms (established and emerging), proven audience sentiment and growth tactics, and a track record of creative and relatable storytelling through content. You can identify and capitalize on new global brand opportunities across social, community and influencers.
* Creator \& Influencer Acumen: Experience working closely with influencers, either directly or in partnership with central teams, to identify key talent and develop impactful activation strategies throughout the game lifecycle.
* Analytical Prowess: A strong ability to establish KPIs and analyze data, measuring performance against KPIs, and translating insights into actionable recommendations for ongoing and future channel or general campaign optimization.
* Exceptional Communication Skills: The ability to effectively influence and collaborate within a matrix organization, across departments, and with international teams.
* Proven People Leadership: Experience providing strong direction and leadership to diverse teams, fostering trust and credibility with direct reports and cross\-functional stakeholders.
* Video Game Savvy: Extensive knowledge of video games culture, particularly core games and the audiences that engage with them.


 As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to ensuring that qualified individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform their essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us if you need reasonable accommodation.
   

  

***Please note that 2K Games and its studios never uses instant messaging apps or personal email accounts to contact prospective employees or conduct interviews and when emailing, only use 2K.com accounts.***
 The pay range for this position in California at the start of employment is expected to be between $209,500 and $310,060 per Year. However, base pay offered is based on market location, and may vary further depending on individualized factors for job candidates, such as job\-related knowledge, skills, experience, and other objective business considerations. Subject to those same considerations, the total compensation package for this position may also include other elements, including a bonus and/or equity awards and eligibility to participate in our 401(K) plan and Employee Stock Purchase Program. Regular, full\-time employees are also eligible for a range of benefits at the Company, including: medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance coverage; 14 paid holidays per calendar year; paid vacation time per calendar year (ranging from 15 to 25 days) or eligibility to participate in the Company’s discretionary time off program; up to 10 paid sick days per calendar year; paid parental and compassionate leave; wellbeing programs for mental health and other wellness support; family planning support through Maven; commuter benefits; and reimbursements for fitness\-related expenses.

title: VP Finance - Corporate Technology
description:
As the Vice President, Finance \- Corporate Technology, you will lead the finance business partner function for a corporate technology alliance and/or security function, working closely with business leaders to deliver dedicated and insightful financial analysis to enable the function to reach its short and long term strategic and financial objectives. They will interact frequently with Technology leaders to deliver financial information and insights in a concise and relevant manner to feed effective decision\-making, while cultivating and maintaining strong relationships. Evaluating strategic technology alternatives in support of long\-term planning and execution, as well as lead a team of finance professionals, setting strategic direction, and ensuring the execution of deliverables make this a pivotal role for our organization.
   

  

 This role reports to the Senior Finance Officer, Technology Finance and will be a hybrid workplace model offering the flexibility to work remotely as well as in our office complex in Alpharetta, GA. (This is not a fully\-remote role)
   

  

 This position does not offer immigration sponsorship (current or future) including F\-1 STEM OPT extension support.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Serve as the lead Finance business partner for a the Technology Alliance teams within Equifax
* Provide financial business partnership to Technology and Product leadership teams in identifying and addressing financial and business issues, bringing effective information to bear, supporting timely decision\-making, and personally driving action and results on initiatives where appropriate
* Analyze technology spending (operating and capital) and trends, and the preparation of reporting and synopsis of the business results to the business and management. Assist in leading the Technology Alliance in evaluating strategic technology alternatives in support of long term planning and execution.
* Responsible for financial management, optimization and of cost of ownership for Cloud environment, including properly tracking, managing and reporting variable costs.
* Ensure the alignment of Cloud capital expenditure with business goals and objectives by working directly with key partners and product owners.
* Oversee the preparation, reporting, and analysis of financial information for the Technology Alliance, including budgets, forecasts, and monthly analyses of results. Prepare executive summaries and conduct financial reviews with business unit leadership that help highlight key trends, variances, strengths and weaknesses within the business performance and contribute to timely management decision\-making. Identify appropriate action plans which respond to opportunities and issues.
* Prepare annual budgets which reflect market conditions, key business drivers and strategic and operating initiatives, and properly balance realism with healthy stretch objectives. Help identify action steps to ensure successful delivery against budget targets.
* Lead development of business cases for capital expenditures and other key initiatives.
* Anticipate business needs, and maintain a strong understanding of key business drivers and industry trends.
* Identify, recruit, develop and retain a high\-performance team of professionals; provide direction, feedback, coaching and prioritization to team


**What experience you need:**
* You have over 10 years of Financial Planning and Analysis experience, as well as experience managing full P\+L’s for technology or security teams of large organizations
* Demonstrated experience successfully leading team of financial analysts
* Recent Finance experience supporting a Cloud environment that includes transformation and migration from legacy to Cloud solutions
* You have a deep understanding of current and emerging Cloud solutions and technologies with experience supporting organizational change to migrate to an Agile/Cloud environment
* You possess Finance experience within a data and systems security priority environment, working to support technical information/cyber security
* You've created and presented complex business cases
* You've demonstrated success collaborating with Finance and Technology functions
* Strong PC skills, with a particular emphasis on Microsoft Excel
* Experienced with the concept of Capitalized Development spending


**What could set you apart:**
* Recent Finance experience supporting Product teams within a technology organization.
* Heavy cost\-out experience would be a big plus
* Possess a financial designation (e.g. CFA or CPA)
* Experience using Hyperion, Oracle Projects and/or OBI (Business Intelligence Objects)

title: Head of Marketing
description:
**About Phaidra**
 Phaidra is building the future of industrial automation.
   

  

 The world today is filled with static, monolithic infrastructure. Factories, power plants, buildings, etc. operate the same they've operated for decades — because the controls programming is hard\-coded. Thousands of lines of rules and heuristics that define how the machines interact with each other. The result of all this hard\-coding is that facilities are frozen in time, unable to adapt to their environment while their performance slowly degrades.
   

  

 Phaidra creates AI\-powered control systems for the industrial sector, enabling industrial facilities to automatically learn and improve over time. Specifically:
   

  

* We use reinforcement learning algorithms to provide this intelligence, converting raw sensor data into high\-value actions and decisions.
* We focus on industrial applications, which tend to be well\-sensorized with measurable KPIs — perfect for reinforcement learning.
* We enable domain experts (our users) to configure the AI control systems (i.e. agents) without writing code. They define what they want their AI agents to do, and we do it for them.


 Our team has a track record of applying AI to some of the toughest problems. From achieving superhuman performance with DeepMind's AlphaGo, to reducing the energy required to cool Google's Data Centers by 40%, we deeply understand AI and how to apply it in production for massive impact.
   

  

 Phaidra's ability to achieve its mission is determined by our ability to work together — as defined by our core values:
 **Transparency** 
 ,
 **Collaboration** 
 ,
 **Operational Excellence** 
 ,
 **Ownership** 
 , and
 **Empathy.** 
 We seek individuals who embody these values, as they are instrumental in ensuring our team consistently delivers excellence and fosters an engaging and supportive culture
   

  

 Phaidra is based in the USA, but we are 100% remote with no physical office. We hire employees internationally with the help of our partner, OysterHR. Our team is currently located throughout the USA, Canada, UK, Italy, Sweden, Spain, Portugal, the Netherlands, Singapore, Australia, and India.
   

  

**Who You Are/The Role**
 Phaidra is hiring its first Head of Marketing. This is a foundational, solo role for a hands\-on, experienced marketer who can define the strategy, create the narrative, generate pipeline, and execute across all channels. You will set the foundation for a scalable marketing function while delivering immediate impact on brand, demand, and revenue.
   

  

 You will report to the CEO and work closely with Sales, Product, and Solutions teams to position Phaidra as the strategic AI partner of choice for AI factories and data centers.
   

  

**We are seeking a team member located within one of the following areas: USA or Canada.**
* **In the United States, we accept applicants located in the following states: California, Colorado, Connecticut, Georgia, Florida, Indiana, Maryland, Minnesota, Missouri, Nebraska, New York, North Carolina, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, Tennessee, Texas, Virginia, Washington.**
* **In Canada, we accept applicants located in the following provinces: Ontario, British Columbia, and Alberta.**


**Responsibilities**
**Strategy \& Leadership**
* Define and own Phaidra's global marketing vision, strategy, positioning, and narrative for AI factories and AI\-native industrial automation.
* Support refinement and execution of Phaidra's AI factory go\-to\-market strategy, positioning Phaidra as the strategic AI partner of choice.
* Build the marketing function from the ground up, including processes, tools, budgeting, reporting, and frameworks for future hires, working closely with the Design team to ensure scaleable, cohesive branding, and visual storytelling.
* Track, report on, and optimize marketing performance using data\-driven KPIs.
* Position Phaidra as a must\-have solution for AI factory build\-outs, reinforcing value to enterprise executives.


**Positioning \& Messaging**
* Translate complex technical capabilities—including reinforcement learning–powered control systems—into clear, compelling messaging for CEOs, CTOs, COOs, and operations leaders.
* Establish Phaidra as a thought leader in AI\-driven industrial optimization and infrastructure efficiency.
* Own Phaidra's narrative, including AI factories, Blackwell\-era infrastructure, and tokens per watt, ensuring messaging resonates with technical and operational audiences.
* Collaborate with Design to create visually engaging content and materials that bring Phaidra's technical value propositions to life.
* Work with Product Development, Solutions, and Design to bring high\-value AI factory use cases to market (e.g., energy efficiency, cooling optimization, power utilization, reliability, performance).


**Demand Generation \& Revenue Enablement**
* Build and execute demand generation programs that drive qualified pipeline and revenue.
* Partner with Sales on ICP definition, target accounts, funnel metrics, and enablement.
* Coordinate with Solutions, Customer, and Design teams to create customer proof points, case studies, and success stories.
* Identify and support scalable channels and partnerships in collaboration with Sales and Business Development.


**Content, Brand \& External Presence**
* Lead content and brand initiatives across blogs, videos, podcasts, website, social media, and other owned channels, partnering closely with Design to create visually consistent, high\-impact assets.
* Turn long\-form content into executive thought leadership and social content, leveraging Design to enhance storytelling and engagement.
* Lead product launches, use\-case storytelling, and customer proof points, ensuring alignment with Design for cohesive brand experiences.
* Own and evolve Phaidra's public image, including LinkedIn presence, website, media relations, and analyst engagement.
* Build relationships with journalists, analysts, and influential industry voices, and secure high\-impact placements across top\-tier media, podcasts, and Substack publications.
* Drive joint announcements with partners to signal momentum and ecosystem leadership, ensuring brand and visual consistency with Design.


 Community \& Ecosystem Engagement
   

  

* Design and execute an events strategy that supports pipeline generation across AI\-factory prospects.
* Collaborate with Design to create visually compelling event materials, presentations, and branding.
* Determine whether and how Phaidra should convene the ecosystem through owned events.
* Build a community strategy for datacenter operators and industrial users, focused on trust, education, and empowerment.
* Ensure Phaidra's presence at top industry conferences, including speaking, sponsorships, dinners, and roundtables with Design input for presentation and visual alignment.


 Onboarding
   

  

**In your first 30 days…**
* Develop working fluency in Phaidra's reinforcement learning technology, AI factory platform, and target customers.
* Review current AI factory customer acquisition efforts, pipeline performance, and marketing\-to\-sales handoffs, and Design collaboration touchpoints.
* Audit existing positioning, website, content, campaigns, and public narrative.
* Build strong relationships with Sales, Product, Solutions, Design, and executive leadership.
* Identify early opportunities and gaps in marketing, tools, and messaging.


**In your first 60 days…**
* Refine and align leadership on AI factory positioning and narrative, clearly differentiating Phaidra from legacy automation and controls solutions.
* Launch or optimize pilot demand generation programs aligned to target customers and revenue goals.
* Establish marketing KPIs, dashboards, and reporting cadence tied to pipeline and revenue projections.
* Define foundational processes and frameworks for future marketing activities (content, campaigns, PR, events) incorporating Design collaboration.


**In your first 90 days…**
* Deliver a scalable marketing strategy and roadmap for the next 12–18 months, including priorities for content, campaigns, PR, events, and Design\-led creative initiatives.
* Show early measurable improvements in pipeline quality, velocity, or conversion through pilot initiatives.
* Roll out consistent messaging across website, sales enablement, and media channels, in alignment with Design.
* Provide a framework for future marketing execution, including resources, processes, and priorities—preparing the organization to scale when the team is built.


**Key Qualifications**
* 10\+ years of marketing experience in tech, with leadership experience at a Series B or later\-stage company.
* Proven track record of driving measurable pipeline and revenue impact through marketing programs—not just brand awareness.
* Experience building and executing marketing strategy from zero (zero\-to\-one experience preferred). Comfortable operating as both strategist and operator.
* Strong background in positioning, messaging, and storytelling for complex technical products; able to simplify without dumbing down.
* Exceptional cross\-functional leader, able to work effectively with Sales, Product, Solutions, and executive leadership.
* Comfortable in highly technical environments, able to explain AI, software, and domain\-specific concepts to non\-experts and sophisticated buyers.
* Ability to operate in ambiguity, take ownership, and build processes, frameworks, and foundations for a growing marketing function.
* Alignment with Phaidra's values: transparency, collaboration, operational excellence, ownership, and empathy.


**Preferred Skills \& Experience**
* Experience marketing complex systems at the intersection of software, hardware, and physical infrastructure, including data centers, energy, industrial automation, or climate tech.
* Hands\-on experience launching integrated marketing programs across digital, content, events, community, and partner channels.
* Experience scaling marketing functions, including establishing KPIs, dashboards, reporting cadence, and marketing operations processes.
* Track record of translating complex technical solutions into clear value propositions and messaging for multiple stakeholders.


 General Interview Process
   

  

 All of our interviews are held via Google Meet, and an active camera connection is required.
   

  

* Meeting with People Operations team member (30 minutes)
* Meeting with VP, Sales (30 minutes)
* Meeting with VP of Analytics \& Observability (30 minutes)
* Meeting with Design (30 minutes)
* Meting with Director, People Operations (30 minutes)
* Culture fit interview with Phaidra's co\-founders (30 minutes)


**Base Salary**
 United States Residents:
   

  

* Tier 1 (Largest highest\-cost metros): $143,200 \- $214,800
* Tier 2 (Other major metros): $136,040 \- $204,060
* Tier 3 (Mid\-sized metro areas): $128,880 \- $193,320
* Tier 4 (All other locations): $121,720\- $182,580


 This position will also include equity.
   

  

 These are best faith estimates of the base salary range for this position. Multiple factors such as experience, education, level, and location are taken into account when determining compensation.
   

  

**Benefits \& Perks**
* Fast\-paced, team\-oriented environment where your work directly shapes the company's direction.
* We are a 100% remote company.
* Competitive compensation \& meaningful equity.
* Outsized responsibilities \& professional development.
* Training is foundational; functional, customer immersion, and development training.
* Medical, dental, and vision insurance (exact benefits vary by region).
* Unlimited paid time off, with a required minimum of 20 days per year.
* Paid parental leave (exact benefits vary by region).
* Flexible stipends to support your workspace, well\-being, and continued professional development.
* Company MacBook.


**Please note:** 
 Not all of Phaidra's benefits and perks listed above apply to temporary employees such as interns.
   

  

**On being Remote**
 We take a thoughtful and intentional approach to remote collaboration. Inspired by pioneers like GitLab, we embrace proven best practices to foster an exceptional remote work environment. Our culture is documentation\-first, and we prioritize asynchronous communication to support focus and flexibility across time zones. While we value independence, we stay closely connected through tools like Slack and video conferencing. Weekly all\-hands meetings help us align and build strong relationships, and we regularly host virtual team\-building activities and social events to maintain a sense of camaraderie.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employment**
 Phaidra is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with Phaidra is governed on the basis of merit, competence, and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability, or any other legally protected status. We welcome diversity and strive to maintain an inclusive environment for all employees. If you need assistance with completing the application process, please contact us at hiring@phaidra.ai.
   

  

**E\-Verify Notice**
 Phaidra participates in E\-Verify, an employment authorization database provided through the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and Social Security Administration (SSA). As required by law, we will provide the SSA and, if necessary, the DHS, with information from each new employee's Form I\-9 to confirm work authorization for those residing in the United States.
   

  

**Additional Information About E\-Verify Can Be Found Here.**
 To be considered for any position at Phaidra, you must submit an online application. This role will remain open until it is filled.
   

  

 Phaidra only hires individuals who are legally authorized to work in the specified location(s) above. We do not provide employment sponsorship. Candidates requiring visa sponsorship, either now or in the future, are not eligible for hire.
   

  

**WE DO NOT ACCEPT APPLICATIONS FROM RECRUITERS.**

title: Director of Corporate & Government Sales
description:
Full\-time Description
   

  

**Work from Home (WFH)** 
 \-
 ***Remote work must be performed while residing in California, New Mexico or Florida***
**CIAT Campus Locations:** 
 San Diego, CA and Albuquerque, NM
   

  

**Reports to:** 
 VP of Strategy \& Analytics
   

  

**Status:** 
 Exempt
   

  

**Employment Type:** 
 Full\-time
   

  

**Overview**
 The Director of Corporate \& Government Sales is responsible for leading CIAT’s growth in corporate, government, and contractor\-funded IT, cybersecurity, cloud, project management and AI bootcamp training programs. We are searching for a data\-driven and growth\-oriented Director to facilitate bootcamp enrollment revenue growth goals and brand building initiatives to meet our five\-year growth plan and beyond. Our ideal candidate thrives in a fast\-growth, entrepreneurial environment, is a collaborative leader that brings new solutions to table and is technically fluent in IT and cyber training conversations. If you are passionate about promoting the important role education plays in changing lives, have the determination to roll up your sleeves and get things done, and have the perseverance to help put CIAT on the map as a leader in technical training, let’s connect.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Execute CIAT’s bootcamp expansion strategy focusing on corporate, government, and contractor enrollment channels
* Strategize with executive leadership team with enrollment forecasting for new and existing bootcamp courses
* Execute monthly, quarterly, and annual plans to meet or exceed revenue goals for bootcamp enrollments
* Establish CIAT as a preferred training provider across federal agencies, state/local governments, and defense contractor ecosystems by aligning bootcamp offerings with compliance frameworks (DoD 8140/8570, cyber readiness, cloud modernization initiatives, and more)
* Lead targeted outreach efforts to prime and subcontractor organizations, government technology leaders, and corporate L\&D/IT managers to drive awareness, relationship development, and training solution adoption across all channels
* Develop and strengthen relationships with U.S. military bases nationwide, including education offices, transition readiness programs, skill development units, and command leadership, to expand awareness and adoption of CIAT’s IT/cyber training solutions
* Represent CIAT at federal, state, and local government technology forums, cybersecurity conferences, cloud summits, and IT/AI training events to build brand visibility and cultivate training solution opportunities
* Attend IT, cyber, and defense industry association events to engage with primes, subs, and government technology leaders aligned with CIAT’s IT/cyber training offerings
* Recruit, coach, motivate, and supervise our growing team of Bootcamp Enrollment Specialists
* Build and instill a “student\-first” collaborative team culture that ensures each Bootcamp Enrollment Specialist enrolls qualified, career\-focused students who will succeed in CIAT’s certification bootcamp programs
* Use a data\-driven approach to identify areas of conversion optimizations within the bootcamp enrollment funnel and build or adapt internal process changes to reach annual performance benchmarks
* Oversee the inbound direct to trainee bootcamp enrollment process, ensuring all prospective inquiries are followed through CIAT communication channels, including phone, email, web, and live chat
* Build, organize, and maintain a dedicated lead database of corporate, government, and contractor prospects, ensuring accurate segmentation, prioritization, and ongoing engagement
* Develop personalized outreach plans for high\-value targets within the lead database, including primes, subs, federal technology units, enterprise IT teams, and training procurement officers
* Manage, monitor, and customize CRM reports to ensure performance targets are achieved and reported on a daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual basis
* Collaborate closely with CIAT internal departments including Admissions, Marketing, Student Services, Career Services, Education, and IT to optimize enrollment performance, streamline trainee onboarding, and expand business development initiatives
* Ensure CIAT policies, procedures, and compliance standards are executed, monitored, and upheld on an ongoing basis
* Monitor and improve internal processes to ensure all Federal, State, accreditation, and institutional policies and procedures are being met
* Provide positive motivation and ongoing training for team members on policy and process changes. Communicate policy updates to staff as needed
* Coach, and counsel employees, in partnership with HR
* Provide professional growth opportunities for employees
* Build and maintain a motivated, professional team by recruiting, selecting, onboarding, coaching, and training employees
* Lead team efforts and foster collaboration across departments
* Support employees through organizational change by communicating clearly, addressing concerns, and modeling adaptability
* Ensure team compliance with all Federal, State, accreditation, and institutional requirements, including workplace policies and standards
* Collaborate with leadership to establish strategic goals by gathering and analyzing business, financial, service, and operational information
* Stay informed about changes and trends in the IT field
* Manage and enforce timekeeping policies to ensure accuracy and timely process of employee’s timecards
* Contribute to team effort by accomplishing results as needed
* Process timely, accurate, fair, without bias, performance reviews
* Embody CIAT’s mission, vision, purpose and values
* Ensure a safe, secure, and ethical work environment


 Requirements
   

  

* Bachelor’s Degree or Master’s degree preferred
* Minimum 5 years of previous experience in a management or leadership capacity supporting corporate IT/cybersecurity business development, government contracting, or training/education solution sales
* Minimum 5 years of experience using enterprise CRM systems such as Microsoft Dynamics or Salesforce
* Strong technical understanding of IT/cyber industry certifications from CompTIA, AWS, Microsoft, Cisco, ISC2 or other IT, cloud and cybersecurity fundamentals
* Strong understanding of DoD 8570/8140 requirements
* Strong understanding of GSA requirements
* Reliable transportation to attend meetings and events
* Must have and be able to present federally accepted identification required for access to military bases and secure facilities
* Proven track record creating and expanding corporate/government training solutions
* Exceptional relationship\-building skills
* Experience engaging primes, subs, and government agencies
* Ability to execute and adapt to changes in strategic initiatives
* Highly proficient in data analysis, reporting, and Microsoft Excel skills to present forecasting models, conversion rate analysis, benchmark performance metrics, and goal setting
* A computer savvy and technical mindset willing to learn new systems that are deployed and build automated processes to streamline manual activities
* Strong presentation, public speaking, and writing skills
* Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to effectively convey information and interact with students, colleagues, and others
* Possess a sincere interest in helping others achieve life goals
* Takes a customer\-service\-oriented approach to recruiting and retaining students and collaborating with internal departments
* Ability to work collaboratively with others to support student success, achieve CIAT goals and contribute to a positive and inclusive culture
* Commitment to fostering an inclusive and supportive environment that respects the diversity of employees and students' backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives
* Self\-motivated, goal\-oriented, assertive, results\-driven and high energy
* Team player with a positive, can\-do attitude
* Strong organizational skills with the proven ability to prioritize
* Possess high ethical standards, being an example of professionalism to others
* Ability to problem solve while maintaining compliance with all policies, procedures, and regulations, including those related to integrity, conduct, and professionalism
* Must be able to embody CIAT’s mission, vision, purpose and values


**Position Type and Expected Hours of Work**
 Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday. Occasional weekend and evening hours may be required. Up to 30% travel may be required, including event participation, or on\-site meetings with corporate or government customers.
   

  

**Supervisory Responsibility**
 Supervises team of Bootcamp Enrollment Specialists and related positions.
   

  

**Values**
 Values such as integrity, excellence, customer service, teamwork and mutual respect are some of those that remain constant, regardless of changes in our company. When identifying company values, it is important that those values are being demonstrated in the course of business each day. Our values set expectations for how employees and managers interact with every person while representing the company.
   

  

* We are passionate about education and student success
* We value integrity and excellence in our employees and students
* We treat ourselves and our students with dignity and respect
* We believe in and encourage innovation at our school to better help our students succeed
* We have a customer centric focus and we want people highly committed to achieving goals, where our success equals student’s success
* We are accountable for our actions, and if errors occur, we focus on preventing future errors and moving forward
* We have a growth mindset, always looking for ways to improve, with a sincere belief that every student can do better and achieve their goals
* We expect every employee to be an example of conduct and professionalism, being a role model to students and colleagues
* We commit to fostering an inclusive and supportive learning environment that respects the diversity of students' backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives
* We foster lifelong learning and professional development


**Physical Demands**
 These physical demands are representative of the physical requirements necessary for an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodation can be made to enable people with disabilities to perform the described essential functions.
   

  

* Essential functions of this role require sitting for extended periods of time
* Ability to type, use a computer to search for information and input information while speaking on the phone is required
* The employee will frequently be required to use the computer, mouse and telephone to conduct the regular tasks of this role
* The employee will be required to compute simple to simple mathematical calculations as a normal part of this role
* Lifting up to 30 lbs. while supporting logistics for event participation


**Work Environment**
 While performing the responsibilities of this remote position, the job holder will work in a home office environment. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable people with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job. This role routinely involves using standard office equipment such as computers, phones, and virtual communication tools. Employees are expected to ensure that their home office is a safe and ergonomic working environment.
   

  

 Employees must maintain data security and confidentiality in accordance with company policies and use secure connections for all work\-related activities. Expectations regarding work hours, availability, and time tracking will be clearly communicated and must be adhered to.
   

  

 The company is not responsible for maintaining home office environments beyond the provision of reasonable accommodations and necessary work\-related equipment. Workers' compensation and liability for injuries that occur in the home office will be covered as per company policy and applicable laws.
   

  

 This remote work policy is designed to comply with all relevant local, state, and federal laws.
   

  

 When in the office, employees are expected to follow all workplace safety rules, security protocols, and professional conduct guidelines. They should maintain a clean and organized work area, be punctual, and actively engage in in\-person meetings, collaboration, and training as scheduled. The in\-office environment may involve occasional noise, shared workspaces, and use of common areas, and employees are expected to be respectful of others working nearby.
   

  

**AAP/EEO Statement**
 California Institute of Applied Technology provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, California Institute of Applied Technology complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
   

  

 California Institute of Applied Technology expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of California Institute of Applied Technology’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.
   

  

**Other Duties**
 Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time, with or without notice.
   

  

**Salary Range**
 The salary range for the Director of Corporate \& Government Sales is $110,000\- $176,000 yearly/DOE. However, the expected starting salary for this position is $110,000\- $140,000 yearly/DOE. We base salary offers on a variety of considerations, such as education, experience, equity and other business and organizational needs.
   

  

 \#ZR
   

  

 Salary Description $110,000\- $140,000 yearly/DOE

title: Manager, Sales
description:
***“Together is growing fast, backed by strong investment and a clear vision to help organizations build impactful mentorship and development programs at scale. This is an exciting time to join a passionate team that cares deeply about making a difference. In this role, you’ll work with forward\-thinking customers committed to developing their people, while shaping how we grow and scale as part of Absorb. You’ll have the freedom to learn, lead, and take on new challenges with real opportunities to advance your career. If you’re driven by purpose, love collaborating with great people, and want to build something that matters, you’ll feel right at home here.”***
**\-** 
 Jon Clement\-Smith, VP Sales
   

  

 Together (an Absorb company) is looking for a driven, results\-oriented
 **Manager, Sales** 
 to build and lead our New Business Sales team. Reporting to the VP of Sales, this role is responsible for accelerating growth through new logo acquisition, developing a high\-performing team of Account Executives, and expanding Together’s footprint with net\-new customers.
   

  

 The Manager, Sales will play a critical role in scaling Together’s go\-to\-market motion. You will recruit, train, and lead a team focused on winning new business, while also remaining hands\-on with customers to close strategic opportunities. If you’re energized by building teams, driving predictable revenue growth, and winning in competitive sales environments, this role offers an exciting opportunity to grow your career alongside a rapidly scaling product and company.
   

  

 Absorb Culture \- Absorb LMS
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Build, lead, and develop a high\-performing New Business Account Executive team focused on net\-new logo acquisition
* Own and drive performance against new revenue targets, including bookings growth and contribution to overall company revenue
* Recruit, hire, onboard, and continuously develop Account Executives to achieve and exceed performance expectations
* Coach AEs on prospecting, discovery, deal strategy, negotiation, and closing to maintain a strong win rate and healthy average deal size
* Maintain accountability for key performance indicators, including percentage of reps hitting quota, pipeline coverage, win rate, and deal quality
* Work directly with customers and prospects on strategic deals, acting as an executive sponsor and supporting complex sales cycles
* Apply and reinforce structured sales methodologies, including MEDDPICC and Challenger, to improve deal quality, forecasting accuracy, and close rates
* Collaborate closely with Marketing to align on demand generation, inbound quality, outbound strategy, and campaign effectiveness
* Partner with Sales Operations, Enablement, and Leadership to refine sales processes, improve forecasting accuracy, and scale repeatable success
* Build a strong sales culture centered on accountability, continuous improvement, and customer\-centric selling
* Actively contribute to cross\-functional initiatives that support Together’s growth, brand presence, and market expansion


**What you’ll bring:**
* 4\+ years of experience leading Enterprise or Mid\-Market New Business Sales teams
* Proven success building and scaling teams focused on new logo acquisition and revenue growth
* Experience managing teams against revenue\-based targets, including bookings, quota attainment, and pipeline performance
* Demonstrated experience using MEDDPICC and Challenger sales methodologies
* A strong track record of maintaining high win rates, consistent average deal sizes, and predictable sales execution
* Demonstrated ability to develop Account Executives, improve ramp time, and increase the percentage of reps achieving quota
* Hands\-on leadership style, comfortable engaging directly with customers and supporting high\-impact deals
* Strong understanding of consultative and enterprise sales motions
* An analytical mindset, with the ability to use performance data to coach effectively, forecast accurately, and drive results
* Experience selling SaaS solutions to HR, People, Talent, or L\&D leaders is an asset


**Technologies we use:**
* Absorb LMS, Together, HubSpot, Zoom, Gong


**Are you ready to become a Togetti?**
**What we offer:**
* Fully remote\-first work with flexible work arrangements
* Comprehensive Health and Wellness Benefits including retirement savings programs, eligibility for two different bonus plans, generous time off, comprehensive medical and dental benefits based on your country of location
* New Hire Equipment Allowance and monthly Flex Allowance to support your success
* Endless opportunity for career growth and internal mobility
* Employee driven DE\&I programs


**Who are we?**
 Together Mentorship Software is part of Absorb Software, a remote\-first company that delivers innovative people development solutions to organizations around the world. Together helps companies design, launch, and scale mentorship programs that drive employee growth, inclusion, and engagement.
   

  

**Our values are simple:**
* We achieve exceptional results by genuinely caring about each other and the work we do
* We’re united, and we grow through our commitment to elevating continual learning!


 Absorb is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating a safe and inclusive environment for all our people. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications. In the event a current Absorb employee would like to apply for this role they will inform their supervisor prior to submitting their application. Successful candidates for this position will be subject to pre\-employment background screening, including a criminal record check and must be able to show proof of legal eligibility to work in the country they have applied to without sponsorship.
   

  

 Should you require any accommodation during the recruitment process, please indicate this on your application and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs. For any questions, please contact us at accessiblecareers@absorblms.com

title: Executive Assistant
description:
**This position is posted by Jobgether on behalf of a partner company. We are currently looking for an Executive Assistant in the United States.**
 This role provides a high\-impact opportunity to support a senior executive while shaping the operational rhythm of the legal function. You will serve as a trusted partner, managing complex calendars, coordinating cross\-functional priorities, and ensuring seamless execution of high\-stakes projects. Beyond traditional executive support, you will maintain key team resources, optimize workflows, and drive operational efficiency for critical legal and governance initiatives. This position requires discretion, precision, and excellent judgment, as well as the ability to anticipate needs, identify risks, and proactively solve problems. You will operate in a fast\-paced, dynamic environment, partnering closely with leadership and cross\-functional teams to ensure priorities are clear, decisions are actionable, and processes are scalable.
   

  

**Accountabilities**
* Provide executive support to the General Counsel, managing complex calendars, prioritizing commitments, and protecting focused work time.
* Drive meeting effectiveness by coordinating attendees, agendas, pre\-reads, capturing decisions, and ensuring follow\-ups are completed.
* Act as a trusted extension of the General Counsel, anticipating needs, surfacing risks, and maintaining confidentiality.
* Manage and maintain team resources, including knowledge bases, checklists, templates, and documentation for legal operations.
* Support litigation and discovery workflows by coordinating with outside counsel, tracking deadlines, and implementing repeatable processes.
* Assist with board and governance preparation, ensuring timely, accurate, and confidential distribution of materials.
* Partner across functions on special initiatives, events, and leadership rhythms to ensure smooth execution and alignment.


**Requirements**
* 5–10\+ years of experience supporting senior executives (VP level or higher), preferably as a senior EA or executive business partner in a fast\-paced, high\-growth environment.
* Demonstrated expertise in complex calendaring, meeting coordination, and stakeholder management.
* Strong organizational skills with experience maintaining systems, documentation, and operational frameworks.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, capable of creating clarity and alignment under pressure.
* Impeccable discretion handling sensitive and confidential information.
* Proficiency with Google Workspace and familiarity with tools such as Notion, Slack, and Jira.
* Preferred: Legal experience (in\-house, law firm, legal ops), supporting governance workflows, or board materials preparation.


**Benefits**
* Competitive base salary within the range of $170,000—$190,000 USD.
* Potential for equity participation.
* Comprehensive health, dental, and vision coverage.
* 401(k) retirement savings plan.
* Flexible PTO and parental leave policies.
* Professional development resources and growth opportunities.
* Supportive, fast\-paced, and collaborative work environment.


**Why Apply Through Jobgether?**
 We use an
 **AI\-powered matching process** 
 to ensure your application is reviewed quickly, objectively, and fairly against the role's core requirements. Our system identifies the top\-fitting candidates, and this shortlist is then shared directly with the hiring company. The final decision and next steps (interviews, assessments) are managed by their internal team.
   

  

 We appreciate your interest and wish you the best!
   

  

 Why Apply Through Jobgether?
   

  

**Data Privacy Notice:** 
 By submitting your application, you acknowledge that Jobgether will process your personal data to evaluate your candidacy and share relevant information with the hiring employer. This processing is based on legitimate interest and pre\-contractual measures under applicable data protection laws (including GDPR). You may exercise your rights (access, rectification, erasure, objection) at any time.
   

  

 We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

title: Vice President of Safety and Compliance
description:
\*\*Base work location – flexible, however required in one of the following markets: Dallas, Texas, Atlanta, Georgia or Nashville, Tennessee\*\*
 



  





 The VP of Safety and Compliance serves as the primary authority on Safety and Department of Transportation regulations across all TransForce divisions. This role is responsible for developing, implementing, managing, and improving the safety and compliance programs for TransForce. This role ensures adherence to all applicable federal, state, and local regulations, particularly those governed by the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration (FMCSA). The VP of Safety and Compliance will support customer safety initiatives, promote a culture of safety, and drive operational excellence across internal operations and customer engagements. The VP of Safety and Compliance will work directly with customers and prospective customers, providing insights on the TransForce approach to safety and compliance can support their operations.
 



  





**Safety Program Development and Management** 




 • Develop and execute a comprehensive safety strategy, aligned with regulatory requirements, including programs to support TransForce’s safety record, training program, incident response, and compliance audits.
 



 • Utilize data to drive continuous improvement in safety performance and work to improve upon TransForce’s current positive safety culture.
 



 • Provide in\-depth analysis of safety and compliance data and make recommendations for improvement.
 



 • Lead the coaching and retraining initiatives for drivers flagged for unsafe behaviors or involved in incidents, using telematics and feedback data
 



 .• Ensure consistent enforcement of safety policies and procedures across all branches and client sites.
 



 • Coordinate and lead regular safety meetings and training sessions for drivers, staff and customers.
 



 • Maintain accurate records of safety incidents, training, inspections, and compliance documentation.
 



  





**Incident Response and Risk Mitigation** 




 • Analyze safety data trends including violations, incidents, and near misses to identify risk areas and recommend proactive improvement measures.
 



 • Oversee internal investigations of all reportable accidents, determine root causes, and implement corrective measures with drivers and customers to prevent recurrence.
 



 • Monitor and manage FMCSA Compliance, Safety, Accountability (CSA) scores and develop strategies to improve safety performance.
 



 • Develop and maintain emergency response protocols for accidents, hazardous materials incidents, and other critical events.
 



 • Conduct regular internal audits and partner with clients to ensure safety standards are upheld in all placements.
 



  





**Regulatory Compliance** 




 • Oversee the compliance function and ensure adherence to FMCSA regulations and state specific laws.
 



 • Monitor and advise on Hours of Service (HOS) compliance. Liaise with customer to address violations with corrective actions.
 



 • Identify updates in federal, state, and local laws and work with operations and HR to develop and implement policies and programs (CA WVPP, FMCSA).
 



 • Serve as the primary liaison with regulatory agencies and ensure timely reporting and resolution of safety incidents.
 



 \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_
 



 Job Experience Requirements:
 



  





 • Minimum twelve years’ DOT Compliance experience required and solid understanding of FMCSR.
 



 • Minimum seven years’ leadership experience.
 



 • Deep knowledge of DOT, FMCSA, CSA, regulations.
 



 • Experience working with telematics and safety analytics tools.
 



 • Experience in a staffing or logistics environment strongly preferred.
 



 • Proven track record of developing and implementing safety programs that reduce incidents and improve compliance.
 



 • Knowledge of how driver leasing fits into compliance with DOT regulations
 



 .• Strong leadership, communication, and analytical skills.
 



 • Ability to travel as needed to client sites and field offices.
 



 • Certified Safety Professional (CSP), Certified Director of Safety (CDS), or similar credential is a plus.
 



 • Excellent presentation skills.
 



 • Excellent relationship building skills.
 



 • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
 



 • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel and PowerPoint).
 



 • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent relevant experience.
 



  





 \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_
 



 Working Conditions:
 



 • Remote \- works in a home office setting
 



 • After hours and weekend availability required
 



 • Travel up to 50%, overnight required
 



 • Base work location – flexible, however required in one of the following markets: Dallas, Texas, Atlanta, Georgia or Nashville, Tennessee
 



 • Ability to respond to safety incidents outside of standard business hours
 



  





 Equal Employment Opportunity Policy
 



  





 TransForce provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
 



  





 This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
 



  





 Americans with Disabilities Act
 



  





 Employee must be able to perform the essential functions of the position satisfactorily and, if requested, reasonable accommodations will be made to enable employees with disabilities to perform the essential functions of their job, absent undue hardship.
company_industry: Staffing and Recruiting, Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage, and Truck Transportation

title: VP of Sales (Starlink / LEO)
description:
**VP of Sales – LEO Satellite Connectivity (Starlink \& Amazon LEO)** 




  





 Inbound Talent is partnered with one of the world's leading LEO Connectivity providers and is proud to be conducting a senior search for an experienced sales professional to help scale US\-based revenue for on\-land deployment of Starlink and Amazon Leo.
 



  





**Remote \| United States** 




  





 A leading reseller of next\-generation LEO satellite connectivity is seeking an experienced VP of Sales to support rapid growth across the US market. The company works closely with Starlink and Amazon Leo, delivering high\-performance, low\-latency connectivity solutions to enterprise customers.
 



 This role is suited to a senior sales professional with a strong background in satellite communications and an established industry network.
 



  





**The Role** 




  





 The VP of Sales will be responsible for driving revenue growth across LEO satellite connectivity solutions, with exposure to wireless connectivity, Private 5G, SDWAN etc where relevant. This is a high\-impact, commercially focused position offering significant autonomy and earnings potential.
 



  





 The successful candidate will be expected to operate as a trusted market expert, capable of originating, developing, and closing complex connectivity opportunities.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  




* Own the full sales lifecycle for LEO satellite connectivity solutions
* Leverage an existing network of enterprise customers
* Develop and close high\-value, recurring\-revenue contracts
* Build and maintain strategic relationships with partners and integrators
* Manage pipeline, forecasting, and revenue reporting
* Provide market and customer insights to support ongoing business strategy



  





**About You** 




  




* Proven sales experience within LEO satellite connectivity, or hybrid GEO / MEO solutions at an authorised Starlink of OneWeb reseller
* Established industry relationships and a demonstrable network of decision\-makers
* Track record of closing six\- and seven\-figure deals
* Comfortable operating independently in a fully remote environment
* Strong commercial acumen with experience selling complex technical solutions



  





**Compensation \& Benefits** 




  




* On\-Target Earnings (OTE): $300,000 – $350,000
* Competitive base salary with uncapped commission
* Profit share opportunity available for the right candidate
* Fully remote role – open to candidates located anywhere in the US
* Opportunity to work at the forefront of next\-generation satellite connectivity



  





**The Opportunity** 




  




* This role offers a chance to join a fast\-growing connectivity business at the forefront of LEO satellite technology, with access to industry\-leading solutions and genuine long\-term upside. It is well\-suited to an entrepreneurial sales leader looking to maximise impact and earnings in a rapidly expanding market.

title: Vice President of Business Development
description:
**JOB SUMMARY**




 The VP – Business Development is responsible for generating new business opportunities and expanding Exzeo’s client base. This role requires a hands\-on, sales\-oriented professional with a technical background who can engage prospects, deliver software demonstrations, and drive adoption of our solutions. This position focuses primarily on personal sales performance and relationship\-building.
 



  





**ESSENTIAL DUTIES \& RESPONSIBILITIES**



* Prospect, qualify, and engage new business opportunities through outbound calls, emails, and networking.
* Conduct live product demonstrations tailored to prospective client needs, highlighting software capabilities and business value.
* Develop and maintain a robust pipeline of leads, tracking activity and progress in the CRM system.
